revision.comment: Remove unicode control characters (CHECKWIKI error 16) using [[Project:AWB|AWB]] (8535)
revision.text:
''This article is about the U.S. charity operating in Angola, for the [[UK]] [[non-profit organization]] see [[RISE International C.I.C.]]''
'''RISE International''' partners with local churches in [[Angola]] to build schools that serve to educate the children of their communities. The buildings also provide a setting for adult education and community meetings.
RISE also sponsors volunteer teams who travel to village school sites in [[Africa]] to conduct workshops, training programs and classes.<ref>[http://www.riseinternational.org/Page.aspx?id=90236 RISE International - Welcome<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
==History== Rise was founded by Dr. Andrew Cole (born in Angola 1953 - 2004) May 2000, Dr. Cole led a short-term relief mission team to the [[Osire]] [[Refugee camp]] in [[Namibia]]. This inspired the formation of a not-for-profit organization in May 2001, called the African Refugee Committee (ARC). With the arrival of peace in Angola, ARC changed its name to RISE International and has now begun to operate primarily within Angola.<ref>[http://www.riseinternational.org/Page.aspx?id=90231 RISE International - RISE History<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.riseinternational.org/ Rise International webpage]
